sen.j: 穴太寺（あなおじ）は、京都府亀岡市にある寺院。
sen.e: Anao-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Kemeoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Anao-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Kemeoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Anao-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号を菩提山（ぼだいさん）と称し、本尊は薬師如来。
sen.e: The temples honorific mountain prefix is 'Bodaisan' and its principal image is Bhaisajyaguru.
The temple`s honorific mountain prefix is 'Bodaisan' and its principal image is Bhaisajyaguru.
The temple's honorific mountain prefix is Bodaisan and its principal image is Bhaisajyaguru.

sen.j: この寺に安置される聖観世音菩薩は西国三十三箇所第21番札所となっている。
sen.e: The Sacred Avalokitesvara enshrined at the temple is the 21st place on the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
The Sacred Avalokitesvara enshrined at the temple is the 21st place on the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
The Sacred Avalokitesvara enshrined at the temple is the 21st of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
sen.cmt: 「西国三十三箇所第21番札所」の表現を修正しました。

sen.j: 天台宗。
sen.e: Tendai Sect
Tendai Sect
Tendai Sect.
sen.cmt: ピリオド追加しました。

sen.j: 「あなおおじ」「あのうじ」と読まれることもあり、「穴穂寺」「穴生寺」とも表記された。
sen.e: The temple's name is also pronounced 'Anaoo-ji' and 'Ano-ji' as well as being written using different kanji for the word 'o'.
The temple's name is also pronounced 'Anaoo-ji' and 'Ano-ji' as well as being written using different kanji for the word 'o'.
The temple's name is also pronounced 'Anao-o-ji' and 'Ano-uji' as well as being written using different kanji (chinese character) for the word 'o'.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Overview
Overview
Summary

sen.j: 飛鳥時代後半の705年（慶雲2年）、文武天皇の勅願により大伴古麻呂が開創したとされる丹波地方の古刹。
sen.e: This ancient temple was founded in the Tanba region in the year 705 during the latter half of the Asuka period by OOTOMO no Komaro under the order of Emperor Monmu.
This ancient temple was founded in the Tanba region in the year 705 during the latter half of the Asuka period by OOTOMO no Komaro under the order of Emperor Monmu.
This ancient temple was founded in the Tanba region in 705 during the latter half of the Asuka period by OTOMO no Komaro under the order of Emperor Monmu.
sen.cmt: 「 the year」を除き「OOTOMO」→「OTOMO」としました。

sen.j: 境内には 江戸時代につくられた本堂・多宝塔を借景にした日本庭園がある。
sen.e: The precinct includes a Japanese garden that incorporates the main hall and Tahoto pagoda into its design.
The precinct includes a Japanese garden that incorporates the main hall and Tahoto pagoda into its design.
The precinct includes a Japanese garden, constructed in the Edo period, that incorporates the main hall and Tahoto pagoda into its design.
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代に」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 本堂内陣に鎌倉時代の作とされる木彫釈迦涅槃像が安置され、体の部分をさわると参拝者の病気がよくなると伝わる。
sen.e: The inner sanctuary of the main hall houses a Kamakura period Shakyamuni Nirvana statue that is said to cure the ailments of temple visitors who touch its body.
The inner sanctuary of the main hall houses a Kamakura period Shakyamuni Nirvana statue that is said to cure the ailments of temple visitors who touch its body.
The inner sanctuary of the main hall houses Wooden Shakyamuni Nirvana statue, supposedly carved in the Kamakura period, that is said to cure the ailments of temple visitors who touch its body.
sen.cmt: 「木造」訳を補足、「鎌倉時代の作とされる」の表現を変えました。

sen.j: 同寺では1月3日、「福給会」が催される。
sen.e: On January 3rd, the Fukutaba-e Ceremony is held at the temple.
On January 3rd, the Fukutaba-e Ceremony is held at the temple.
On January 3, the Fukutaba-e Ceremony (Nirvana Ceremony) is held at the temple.
sen.cmt: 「福給会」の英訳を補足しました。

sen.j: これは、300年以上続く伝統行事で、1から33番までの札3000枚を本堂から巻き、拾った番号によってくじが行なわれる。
sen.e: In this over 300 year old tradition, 3,000 cards numbered 1 to 33 are thrown from the main hall and a draw held depending on the number picked up.
In this over 300 year old tradition, 3,000 cards numbered 1 to 33 are thrown from the main hall and a draw held depending on the number picked up.
Fukubata-e has a traditional event since more than 300 years that 3,000 cards numbered 1 to 33 are thrown from the main hall and a draw is held depending on the number picked up.
sen.cmt: 「Fukubata-e」を主語にし、表現を少し変えました。

sen.j: 3枚だけ赤い札が入っており、それを拾った人は1年間幸せに過ごせるという。
sen.e: There are three red cards and each card makes a person who picks up live happily for a year.
sen.cmt: 訳文がありませんでしたので、補いました。

sen.j: 本堂 - 1735年再建、京都府指定文化財
sen.e: Main hall: Rebuilt in 1735 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Main hall: Rebuilt in 1735 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Main hall: Rebuilt in 1735 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.j: 多宝塔 - 1804年再建、京都府指定文化財
sen.e: Tahoto pagoda: Rebuilt in 1735 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Tahoto pagoda: Rebuilt in 1735 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Tahoto pagoda: Rebuilt in 1804 and designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.j: 仁王門 - 江戸時代中期再建、京都府登録文化財
sen.e: Nio-mon gate (two-storied gate): Rebuilt during the mid-Edo period and registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Nio-mon gate (two-storied gate): Rebuilt during the mid-Edo period and registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Nio-mon gate (two-storey gate): Rebuilt during the mid-Edo period and registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.e: Chinju-do hall (guardian god hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Chinju-do hall (guardian god hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Chinju-do hall (guardian god hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.e: Nembutsu-do hall (Nembutsu hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Nembutsu-do hall (Nembutsu hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Nembutsu-do hall (Nembutsu hall): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.e: Belfry: Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.e: Hojo/Kuri (abbot's chamber and monk's living quarters): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Hojo/Kuri (abbot's chamber and monk's living quarters): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Hojo/Kuri (abbot's chamber and monk's living quarters): Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.e: Hojo front gate: Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Hojo front gate: Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Hojo front gate: Registered as a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.j: 木造聖観音立像（伝感世作） - 国の重要文化財
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara: A nationally designated Important Cultural Property.
Wooden standing statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara: A nationally designated Important Cultural Property.
Wooden standing statue of Sacred Avalokitesvara (supposedly carved by Kansei) : A nationally designated Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 「伝感世作」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 穴太寺観音縁起 - 京都府指定文化財
sen.e: Ano-ji Kannon Engi (history of Ano-ji Kannon): Designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Ano-ji Kannon Engi (history of Ano-ji Kannon): Designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Anao-ji Kannon Engi (history of Anao-ji Kannon): Designated a Cultural Property by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

sen.j: 穴太寺庭園 - 江戸時代中期作庭、京都府指定文化財名勝
sen.e: Ano-ji Garden: This mid-Edo period garden has been designated a place of scenic beauty by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Ano-ji Garden: This mid-Edo period garden has been designated a place of scenic beauty by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Ano-ji Garden: Constructed in the mid-Edo period and designated a place of scenic beauty by the Kyoto Prefectural Government.

Anao-ji Temple buildings: Designated Cultural Properties by Kameoka City.
